definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: Graduation ceremony is an important part of rituals activities in school.
sentences.chinese: 毕业典礼是学校生活中的一种重要仪典活动。

sentences.english: The history of the nuptial pastry, though, is even stranger than these modern rituals suggests.
sentences.chinese: 然而婚庆糕点史比这些现代仪典表现的还要离奇。

sentences.english: The humbler gentes had their common rites .
sentences.chinese: 卑微的氏族有其共同仪典。

definition: to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)
to offer thanks to the gods
to offer sacrifices to the gods
